A classroom in downtown
Bangkok is testing an air filtration system
to deal with high levels of dust
in polluted air. Young children were
chosen for the survey because they  have a
faster breathing rate than
adults in this classroom located between a park and a
busy boulevard since November through
testing of filters placed in air
conditioners to filter out fine dust testing
carried out through a contract  In partnership with
Longc Bangkok University, the project is being conducted at
four educational institutions to allow teachers and
students to monitor the level of air pollution
they breathe into their lungs. The school has a
Warning system that uses flag colors to reflect
Air quality: If students do not
wear masks like the N95 type, they will
absorb fine dust in polluted air through their respiratory system,
causing their health to
decline in the first months of the
year in Bangkok city.
Air pollution accompanied by hot weather, there were
times when the Thai capital of 12 million
people was on the list of the
most polluted cities in the world with the amount of fine dust
BM 2.5 exceeding the health organization's warning threshold.  The
world's habit of burning straw and
smoke from factories and car engines is the
main cause of pollution clouds
in major cities.
Last February, Sebastian Voion was
voted the world's best restaurant pastry chef.
He came up with menus

Honor for

this chef was recognized in the

Few people know about the peach blossom route in

future youth tournaments including the
men's and
women's World Cups, according to which from 2025 these tournaments
will take place regularly every year.  Instead of
only being held every two years as currently,
FIFA decided to increase the number of teams
participating in the U17 World Cup finals for men
from 24 to 48 and for women increased from 16 to 24
teams. FIFA also announced that Qatar will host  The
U17 Men's World Cup from 2025 to 2029
and the U17 women's finals will be held in
Marok during the same period. Due to
these changes by Fifa, Vietnamese youth football
